text: Today’s beginner dialogue teaches some vital sentences to use when shopping (买东西).太…了(le) is a very useful construct. 太贵了 means “too expensive”, while 太矮了 means “too short”.Simply place an adjective between 太 and 了.小明：Hello, I want to buy a watch. How much money is this?小明：This watch is too expensive, do you have anything cheaper?Shop assistant：This black watch is 200 yuan.小明：Does it come in other colors?小明：Then I will buy this red watch.
